New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers improved to 5-0, their best start since the 2016-17 season
Key Match Events: Cavaliers led by as many as 28 points
LeBron James finished with 26 points, six rebounds and six turnovers
Bronny James scored his first NBA points on a step-back, 14-foot jumper
Cavaliers shot 17-of-22 from the floor in the first quarter and made 8 of 13 treys
Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland crowd started chanting, 'We Want Bronny'
LeBron James was cheered throughout pre-game warm-ups and during his traditional pregame powder toss along the scorer's table
Post-Match Reflections: Cavaliers coach on the team's 5-0 start: no comment
Miscellaneous Highlights: LeBron James' dunk to make it 4-0 was the biggest highlight of the first quarter for the Lakers
Cavaliers forward Georges Niang celebrated after hitting a three-point basket
Cleveland led a major foul disparity, committing 26 fouls to Los Angeles' seven
Others: Lakers star Anthony Davis finished with 22 points and 13 rebounds
Bronny James entered with 5:16 left and the Cavaliers up 119-98
